title.value: Vārta: A Large-Scale Headline-Generation Dataset for Indic Languages
title.justification: The title is mentioned at the top of the research paper.
title.quote: Vārta: A Large-Scale Headline-Generation Dataset for Indic Languages

extractions.description: This paper introduces Vārta, a substantial multilingual dataset aimed at the task of headline generation in 14 Indic languages and English. The dataset is utilized in various experiments to explore its efficacy in Indic NLP and multilingual research, showing that it is challenging for state-of-the-art models and beneficial for pretraining strong language models.

type.justification: The research involves collecting a large-scale dataset and running a series of experiments to evaluate its effectiveness.
type.quote: We use the data collected in a series of experiments to answer important questions related to Indic NLP and multilinguality research in general.

name.justification: The primary focus of the dataset and experiments revolves around tasks related to Natural Language Processing such as headline generation and abstractive summarization.
name.quote: We present Vārta, a large-scale multilingual dataset for headline generation in Indic languages.

name.justification: The paper references machine translation models and highlights the translation difficulties among Indic languages.
name.quote: For example, though most Indic languages are closely related, they use different scripts which makes transfer learning harder.

name.justification: The primary task discussed is headline generation, a form of text summarization.
name.quote: Headline generation is a special case of abstractive summarization where the goal is to create a brief, often single-sentence ‘summary’ of a news article.

name.justification: mT5 is a key model used in the experiments for headline generation and pretraining tasks.
name.quote: mT5 introduced by Xue et al. (2021), it is the multilingual variant of T5 (Raffel et al., 2022).

is_contributed.justification: mT5 was not introduced by this paper; it was used as a baseline.
is_contributed.quote: mT5 introduced by Xue et al. (2021), it is the multilingual variant of T5 (Raffel et al., 2022).

is_executed.justification: The mT5 model was executed on the dataset for various experiments.
is_executed.quote: We finetune each model described in §4.2 on Vārta in five settings.

is_compared.justification: The performance of mT5 is compared to other models such as Vārta-T5 and mBERT.
is_compared.quote: Overall, Vārta-T5 finetuned in the all setting performs the best with an average ROUGE - L of 40.48.
